meanings.definition: To be in charge or control of a meeting or event.
meanings.sent1: She presided over the school assembly.
meanings.sent2: The mayor presided over the city council meeting.
meanings.sent3: The cat presided over the gathering of birds in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The sun presided over the sky, casting its warm rays.
meanings.sent5: The queen bee presided over her buzzing subjects in the hive.

meanings.definition: To be the leader or head of a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: He presided as the captain of the soccer team.
meanings.sent2: The CEO presided over the company's board of directors.
meanings.sent3: The teddy bear presided over the stuffed animal tea party.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse presided over the rocky coastline, guiding ships safely.
meanings.sent5: The alpha wolf presided over the pack, ensuring order and unity.
